item.title: Leonaylor
item.dc:creator: @xx_matty_xx Justin Bieber
item.description:
@xx_matty_xx wrote:

[quote=“triston001, post:10, topic:451972”][quote author=Crusader1789 link=topic=554854.msg4068986#msg4068986 date=1344183493]
hey just saying, but i dont mind PvP as long as we dont immediately start killing each other in the beginning to the point where we can barely have time to build a house. i dont want any hunger games kind of stuff because thats what happened in another server i have… wasnt pretty.
[/quote]
i sorta doubt it will have too much of an effect on griefers. now please pardon me, as i have difficulty in expressing my ideas, so i will write this in length, but i think some of the reasons would be because for the issue of them directly griefing, this would only work if the owner or neighbor was in the area at the time, assuming the griefer is able to easily be killed and the griefee has to armour and sword to swiftly kill, to kill the griefer. we must also remember that this wont stop the griefer from repeatedly coming back to grief and pester the victim, before it can be dealt with in a report. furthermore, i dont think this would be a good reason to turn it on. but in the case we do, a good thought for a rule would be to make it against excessive pvp/killing against a person who does not wish to pvp and isnt bugging anyone (a person who is trying to build something on there property or get somewhere or mine) instead of the “expressing dominence” rule which caused alot of stupid reports. again, however, the person would have to wait for the report to be dealt with, assuming they offender does not decide to do it yet again. perhaps we should enable it for certain individuals if we do decide to enable pvp. ((notify me if i should place this in suggestion instead))[/quote]I had a serious problem with griefers in my city a few worlds ago - it averaged at around 1-2 incidents per day, and sometimes the same people would keep coming back to grief throughout the day (because they were butthurt about being banned). It sometimes took up to a week for a member of staff to come on and roll stuff back, so PvP helped me keep the griefers at bay - they soon get bored when you keep sending them back to spawn. Griefers also very rarely have good weapons/armour because they don’t devote much time to a server they’re gonna get banned on, and they can’t even xray anymore.

But yeah I agree that if we ever do enable PvP we need more strict rules around excessive and unfair behaviour - like if a group of people clearly state that they’re friendly and don’t attack anyone, then nobody should be allowed to attack them unless they start a fight first.

Read full topic

item.title: Leonaylor
item.dc:creator: @triston001 triston001
item.description:
@triston001 wrote:

Crusader1789:

hey just saying, but i dont mind PvP as long as we dont immediately start killing each other in the beginning to the point where we can barely have time to build a house. i dont want any hunger games kind of stuff because thats what happened in another server i have… wasnt pretty.

i sorta doubt it will have too much of an effect on griefers. now please pardon me, as i have difficulty in expressing my ideas, so i will write this in length, but i think some of the reasons would be because for the issue of them directly griefing, this would only work if the owner or neighbor was in the area at the time, assuming the griefer is able to easily be killed and the griefee has to armour and sword to swiftly kill, to kill the griefer. we must also remember that this wont stop the griefer from repeatedly coming back to grief and pester the victim, before it can be dealt with in a report. furthermore, i dont think this would be a good reason to turn it on. but in the case we do, a good thought for a rule would be to make it against excessive pvp/killing against a person who does not wish to pvp and isnt bugging anyone (a person who is trying to build something on there property or get somewhere or mine) instead of the “expressing dominence” rule which caused alot of stupid reports. again, however, the person would have to wait for the report to be dealt with, assuming they offender does not decide to do it yet again. perhaps we should enable it for certain individuals if we do decide to enable pvp. ((notify me if i should place this in suggestion instead))

Read full topic
